New Records: Luis Gil pitched six sparkling innings in his return from a back injury, allowing the Cubs' only hit â€” Cody Bellinger's fourth-inning double.
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit an RBI double and scored on Austin Wells' two-run single as the Yankees scored three times in the third inning.
The Yankees' first shutout since Aug. 23 against the Colorado Rockies and No. 12 on the season.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees (81-60) improved to 2-2 on a six-game trip that began with a difficult series at Texas. They trailed AL East-leading Baltimore by a half-game going into Friday's action.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Aaron Boone said, 'It was a good day.'
Manager Craig Counsell said, 'I thought Gil threw the ball well, but we got to do a better job.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Rizzo went 1-for-3 with a walk in his first game at Wrigley since the Cubs traded him to the Yankees in July 2021.
Others: The Yankees are going with a closer-by-committee approach after Clay Holmes surrendered a game-ending grand slam in a 7-4 loss to the Rangers on Tuesday night.
